# Draft:Coryell Museum and Historical Center

The [https://coryellmuseum.com Coryell Museum and Historical Center] is a non-profit institution in Gatesville, Texas.  The museum is dedicated to preserving and showcasing the history of Coryell County.  Established in 1986, the museum offers a diverse array of exhibits and collections, ranging from the 1800-1900s, each one offering a unique glimpse into the past.
History
Founded in 1986, the Coryell Museum and Historical Center was established with the vision to preserve, document, exhibit, and educate the public about the history of Coryell County.  The museum was originally housed in the old Graham Lumber Yard.  The donation of the Bigham building by Wes Gilbreath, in 1995, allowed the museum tomove to its current location, sparking the founding of this pivotal institution for the community.  It is now home to an extensive collection of historical relics.
With the donation of the Lloyd Mitchell Spur Collection in 1995, the museum proudly houses the key to Gatesville's title as the Spur Capital of Texas.
Exhibits and Collections
Lloyd and Madge Mitchell Spur Collection
One of the museum's most notable features is the Lloyd and Madge Mitchell Spur Collection, recognized as one of the world's largest collection of spurs.  This extensive exhibit showcases over 6,000 spurs from Lloyd Mitchell's personal collection, highlighting the significance of spurs in Western Heritage.
Spurs on display include a pair belonging to former First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy and a pair belonging to Pancho Villa.  These artifacts span from the 13th to the 20th century, with a particular emphasis on the 1800s to early 1900s, showcasing the diverse designs and functions of spurs throughout history.
The Old Log Jail
The museum proudly displays the first public building erected in Coryell County, which was a double-wall log jail.  One of the few, if not the only, surviving double-wall log structures still standing in the United States, this structure was built in 1855, one year after the establishment of Coryell County.  The prisoners were kept under the jail in a four foot tall space, with the jailer inside the log structure above.  This is truly a unique display and is a visitor favorite.
Coryell County Military and Veteran's Display
Visitors can explore personal artifacts, photographs, and narratives that highlight the bravery and sacrifices of local heroes by chronicling their service from the Texas Revolution through Operation Iraqi Freedom.  This comprehensive exhibit not only commemorates the valor of Coryell County's servicemen and women, but also educates the public on the region's significant contributions to military history.
Other Exhibits
In addition to the spur collection, the museum houses a variety of exhibits that recreate historical settings, including an authentic soda fountain from a local drug store, an apothecary, a blacksmith shop, the Buckhorn Saloon, and antique Model T cars from 1915 and 1923.  Other displays tell the story of Coryell County, from pioneer times through the 1940s.  These displays offer visitors a glimpse into the daily life of Coryell County's early inhabitants.
Events
Annual Spurfest
The museum annually hosts Spurfest, a celebration held every third Saturday in September.  This festival honors the county's heritage with a day filled with music, games, performances, and various family-friendly activities.  Spurfest serves as a platform to connect the community and visitors with the profound history of Coryell County, paying homage to its renowned spur collection.
Visiting Information
The Coryell Museum and Historical Center is located at 718 E. Main Street, Gatesville, Texas  76528.  It is open to the public Wednesday-Saturday between 10am and 4pm.  Parking and admission to the museum are free for all ages, though donations are appreciated to support it's all volunteer mission.  The museum is handicapped accessible.
Community Engagement
The museum offers various opportunities for community involvement, including membership programs, volunteer positions, and venue rentals.  Our staff is all volunteer, so they play a crucial role in daily operations, assisting in areas such as administration, education, collections care, and special events.  These initiatives aim to foster a deeper connection between the museum and the local community, ensuring the preservation and celebration of Coryell County's heritage for future generations.
